thread.title: Cops spray mate in brawl with two women
thread.title_full: Cops spray mate in brawl with two women

title: Cops spray mate in brawl with two women
text:
Share on Twitter 
A POLICEMAN was hit with friendly fire after a colleague inadvertently struck him with capsicum spray as ten officers tried to subdue two brawling women in Prymont overnight. 
The two women were photographed laying wailing in the street, one clad only in her underwear, handcuffed by a team of police officers who had been called to quell the disturbance. 
Officers help one policeman rinse his eyes with bottled water, having copped capsicum spray in the face during the brawl. A woman is subdued in the gutter as officers treat a colleague hit by capsicum spray. Picture: Gordon McComiskie   
Witnesses said the pair had left a taxi without paying near Pyrmont Bridge Road before trying to engage passers-by in conversation, about 3.45am. 
The pair kept walking away from the taxi, before becoming aggressive in the middle of the street. 
“They came down here screaming, in the middle of the road, waving,” one witness said. 
He said the pair attempted to hug the man before he rebuffed their advances. Officers with one of the women arrested at the scene. Picture: Gordon McComiskie   A woman is restrained by an oficer at the scene. Picture: Gordon McComiskie   A paramedic treats one of the women. Picture: Gordon McComiskie   Paramedic treats officer hit by capsicum spray. Picture: Gordon McComiskie   
“They were still in the middle of the road causing a ruckus and then the cops came down, and it just got out of hand…and they started throwing punches,” he said. 
More than 10 police were on scene to subdue the pair. 
Police successfully managed to separate the pair, handcuffing them and bringing them under control. 
One woman wore only a bra and underwear as she lay wailing in the gutter. 
It took several attempts by police to get the woman out of the gutter and into the back of a police van. 
Finally, with the combined effort of six police officers they manage to get her into the back of the truck, and were being questioned by police this morning.
